com.paypal.merchant.sdk

Interface CardReaderManager


  • public interface CardReaderManager
    CardReaderManager is the entry point for interacting with CardReaders used for
    credit card processing.
    The CardReaderManager lets the caller tap into feedback events from the underlying
    Card Reader without having to worry about the finer details of how the card readers work.
    Typically, application developers would want to tap into Card Reader related events together with
    the TransactionManager related events to get more context. However, in some cases, apps may just
    want to tap into the raw events from the card reader layer to implement more advanced functionality.

    • Field Detail

      • INTENT_STRING_BLUETOOTH_DEVICE

        static final String INTENT_STRING_BLUETOOTH_DEVICE
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • waitForAuthorization

        void waitForAuthorization()
        This API is used to indicate to the CardReader layer that the application is now interested in
        scanning for card data through one of the connected devices. Typically, applications do not have
        to worry about controlling this as this part is taken care of automatically by the TransactionManager
        However, this function is available should the app wish to take control of this timing on its own.
        NOTE: if you decide to use this API rather than rely on the transaction manager to this automatically for you then make sure that this gets called before attempting a card swipe or a card insert into one of the
        reader devices. Without invoking this call the peripherals layer will NOT listen for card data from the peripherals

      • cancelWaitForAuthorization

        void cancelWaitForAuthorization()
        This is API is used by other parts of the SDK as well as by applications to indicate that we are no longer
        interested in listening for authorization events (such as doing a card swipe)
        The TransactionManager internally puts the CardReaderManager to "sleep" when a payment is cancelled or when the
        application explicitly invokes the cancel APIs in the TransactionManager. This is an important step needed to ensure that
        the battery in both these CardReaders as well as in the mobile device is conserved.

      • registerCardReaderListener

        void registerCardReaderListener(CardReaderListener listener)
        Use this method to register a custom listener to tap into the various events associated with the payment reader.
        Parameters:
        listener; - the listener interface defines the callbacks that will be invoked by the CardReaderManager. Registering the same observer multiple times will simply get ignored and the observer will just be registered once.

      • registerCardReaderConnectionListener

        void registerCardReaderConnectionListener(CardReaderConnectionListener listener)
        Use this method to register a listener to get card reader connection related events
        Parameters:
        listener - the connection listener interface which defines the callbacks related to card reader connection. Registering the same observer multiple times will simply get ignored and the observer will just be registered once.

      • registerCardReaderBatteryListener

        void registerCardReaderBatteryListener(CardReaderBatteryListener listener)
        Use this method to register a listener to get card reader battery related events.
        Parameters:
        listener - the battery listener interface which defines the callbacks related to card reader battery. Registering the same observer multiple times will simple get ignored and the observer will just be registered once.

      • unregisterCardReaderListener

        void unregisterCardReaderListener(CardReaderListener listener)
        Unregister a previously registered CardReaderListener object. This will stop notifications coming through to this listener and the reference to this listener will be released. If the listener object is null or is not previously registered the SDK will silently ignore the call.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object that was previously registered.

      • unregisterCardReaderConnectionListener

        void unregisterCardReaderConnectionListener(CardReaderConnectionListener listener)
        Unregister a previously registered CardReaderConnectionListener object. This will stop notifications coming through to this listener and the reference to this listener will be released. If the listener object is null or is not previously registered the SDK will silently ignore the call.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object that was previously registered.

      • unregisterCardReaderBatteryListener

        void unregisterCardReaderBatteryListener(CardReaderBatteryListener listener)
        Unregister a previously registered CardReaderBatteryListener object. This will stop notifications coming through to this listener and the reference to this listener will be released. If the listener object is null or is not previously registered the SDK will silently ignore the call.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object that was previously registered.

      • connectToDevice

        void connectToDevice(android.app.Activity activity,
                     android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
                     DefaultResponseHandler<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice,PPError<CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinConnectionStatus>> handler)
        This method is called to establish the connection with bluetooth based card reader device. When the application calls this method, SDK will take care of showing the UI while connection is in progress.
        Parameters:
        activity - Current running activity to show the UI as and when needed during connection process.
        device - A BluetoothDevice object that represents a previously paired BluetoothDevice. This is a standard Android
        object and more information can be found at developer.android.com
        handler - Response handler for this call.

      • connectToDevice

        void connectToDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
                     ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler<CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinStatusResponse,PPError<CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinConnectionStatus>> handler)
        Use this method to initiate a connection with a bluetooth based Card reader device. Usually, this is one of the
        Chip & Pin CardReaders that are integrated with PayPal out of the box.
        Note that this is an asynchronous call and returns status messages via the passed in response closure.
        Establishing connection to a Bluetooth Reader is an explicit action that needs to be performed by the application
        When connecting to a PayPal Reader the SDK does the following:
        1. Establishes connection and checks the software status of the Reader to determine if updates are necessary. If
        so, then the response handler passed in here will be called back with the appropriate status
        2. Checks the battery status to ensure that the PayPal Reader is ready to process transaction. If battery levels
        are too low then a ChipAndPinEvent is invoked on the CardReaderListener to notify the app
        Parameters:
        device - A BluetoothDevice object that represents a previously paired BluetoothDevice. This is a standard Android
        object and more information can be found at developer.android.com
        handler - this is the response handler for this call. This API is asynchronous and status update is only available
        via this handler

      • disconnectFromDevice

        void disconnectFromDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device)
        Disconnect from a previously connected BluetoothDevice object
        Parameters:
        device - name of the bluetooth device which needs to be disconnected

      • initiateSoftwareUpdate

        void initiateSoftwareUpdate(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
                            ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler<CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinStatusResponse,PPError<CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinSoftwareUpdateStatus>> handler)
        Once connected to a device the application will be notified if a software update is required/available for this
        PayPal Reader. If a software update is required, then the application can use this API to initiate the software update
        process. Typically, user notification/permission is needed before software update can proceed which is why the trigger
        for software update is left in control of the application. However, if a software update is mandatory then transactions
        will not succeed with the software update being performed.
        Parameters:
        device - This is the BluetoothDevice object whose software needs to be updated. It is usually the same object
        that was passed in during the connectToDevice() call.
        handler - Software update is an asynchronous process that involves several stages. This response handler is
        used by the SDK to notify the application with status updates. Unlike persistent listeners such as the CardReaderListener the software update is controlled via the
        ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler
        . See documentation for ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler for more details
        on usage.

      • initiateSoftwareUpdate

        void initiateSoftwareUpdate(android.app.Activity activity,
                            android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
                            DefaultResponseHandler<Boolean,PPError<CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinSoftwareUpdateStatus>> handler)
        Once connected to a device the application will be notified if a software update is required/available for this
        PayPal Reader. If a software update is required, then the application can use this API to initiate the software update
        process. Typically, user notification/permission is needed before software update can proceed which is why the trigger
        for software update is left in control of the application. However, if a software update is mandatory then transactions
        will not succeed with the software update being performed.
        Parameters:
        activity - current foreground activity. This activity will be used to show the appropriate UI as and when we proceed with software update
        device - This is the BluetoothDevice object whose software needs to be updated. It is usually the same object
        that was passed in during the connectToDevice() call.
        handler - Software update is an asynchronous process that involves several stages. This response handler is
        used by the SDK to notify the application with status updates. Unlike persistent listeners such as the CardReaderListener the software update is controlled via the
        DefaultResponseHandler
        . See documentation for DefaultResponseHandler for more details
        on usage.

      • cancelSoftwareUpdate

        void cancelSoftwareUpdate()
        If there is a software update in progress, calling this method will end it prematurely. This must only be used under extreme circumstances, and mostly on an user action, willing to cancel the process, either because the phone is on a slow connection or impatience!

      • getBatteryLevel

        void getBatteryLevel()
        This API can be invoked on demand to get the current battery level of the PayPal Reader. This is an asynchronous API
        the response will be available through the onCardReaderEvent() callback defined in the CardReaderListener object.
        Usage is as follows: 1. CardReaderManager.getInstance().registerCardReaderListener(myListener) 2. CardReaderManager.getInstance().getBatteryLevel() The battery level will be reported via the onCardReaderEvent. See documentation in onCardReaderEvent for more details on this usage.

      • providePaymentDecision

        void providePaymentDecision(ChipAndPinDecisionEvent decisionEvent)
        This API is to be invoked by the app in response to the DecisionRequired event. In Chip based card
        sometimes multiple applications are supported by the same card and the user is required to select a particular application
        The SDK notifies the app via the onCardReaderEvent() with the event type set to DecisionRequired and
        provides the list of payment application types via the onSelectPaymentDecision() method in the CardReaderListener.
        The application is required to display this list to the user for selection
        and once a selection is made, has to pass in the selected object back into the SDK to continue with the transaction.
        Parameters:
        decisionEvent - This is the user selected decisionEvent based on the list provided by the SDK to the app.

      • getEMVDeviceData

        EMVDeviceData getEMVDeviceData()
        This API can be invoked on demand to obtain information about the connected EMV device.
        Information would contain : OS Version, Firmware version etc.
        Returns:
        A EMVDeviceData object through which relevant information about their EMV terminal could be retrieved.

      • startAudioJackMonitoring

        CardReaderManager.BeginMonitoringStatus startAudioJackMonitoring()
        This API will start listening for the card swipers on the specified port. The port can be anything specified in the enum ReaderConnectionTypes

      • endAudioJackMonitoring

        void endAudioJackMonitoring()
        This API will stop listening for the card swipers on the specified port. The port can be anything specified in the enum ReaderConnectionTypes

      • getAvailableReaders

        List<CardReaderManager.CardReader> getAvailableReaders()
        Allows the app (or other SDK internals) to discover what readers are available.

        Returns:
        ArrayList an array of the different reader types that are currently
        available. Currently available indicates that these devices are already paired/physically connected
        etc.

      • setActiveReader

        void setActiveReader(CardReaderListener.ReaderTypes type)
        Allows the app to set one of the available readers as active reader.
        Parameters:
        type - ReaderType which can be used as active reader

      • getActiveReaderType

        CardReaderListener.ReaderTypes getActiveReaderType()
        Allows the app to get the type of the reader which is active at this point of time
        Returns:
        active reader type

      • getActiveConnectedPort

        CardReaderListener.ReaderConnectionTypes getActiveConnectedPort()
        This API will return you to which port the sdk is currently connected. Audio Jack or Bluetooth
        Returns:
        port to which it was connected

      • emitCardReaderConnectedEvent

        void emitCardReaderConnectedEvent()
        Cause the SDK to emit a card reader connected event. This is can be used to assist in testing your app without having to connect physical device.

      • getCardReaderSoftwareUpdateStatus

        CardReaderManager.CardReaderSoftwareUpdateStatus getCardReaderSoftwareUpdateStatus()
        Use this api to get the software updated status of the current connected device.

      • getDeviceCompatibilityModel

        DeviceCompatibility getDeviceCompatibilityModel()
        To get the Device Compatibility Model
        Returns:
        DeviceCompatibility interface which implements isModelSupported

      • registerCardReaderKeyboardListener

        void registerCardReaderKeyboardListener(CardReaderManager.CardReaderEventListener listener)
        Register for card reader key press events and get notified when confirm, cancel and back arrow buttons are pressed on the reader.
        Parameters:
        listener - A CardReaderEventListener for notifying key press events.

      • unregisterCardReaderKeyboardListener

        void unregisterCardReaderKeyboardListener()
        Un register for card reader key press events.
